metadata.Title: CVE-2023-28772 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.13.3. lib/seq_buf.c has a seq_buf_putmem_hex buffer overflow.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-28772` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-156-generic - 4.15.0-156.163
linux-image-4.15.0-156-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-156.163
linux-image-4.15.0-156-lowlatency - 4.15.0-156.163
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-156-generic - 4.15.0-156.163
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-156-lowlatency - 4.15.0-156.163
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1111-aws - 4.15.0-1111.118
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1056-aws - 5.4.0-1056.59~18.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: cascardo> there is no current seq_buf_putmem_hex user with exploitable input

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-156.163').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1111.118').
linux-aws-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
